definition:
[**Definition**]{}

Let $x_1$, $x_2,\ldots, x_n$ be real numbers, and $f$ a continuous and
strictly increasing or decreasing function on the real numbers. If each
number $x_i$ is assigned a weight $p_i$, with $\sum_{i=1}^n p_i= 1$, for
$i=1,\ldots,n$, then the *generalized mean* is defined as
$$f^{-1}\Big( \sum_{i=1}^n p_i f(x_i) \Big).$$

[**Special cases**]{}

1.  $f(x)=x$, $p_i=1/n$ for all $i$: arithmetic mean

2.  $f(x)=x$: weighted mean

3.  $f(x)=\log(x)$, $p_i=1/n$ for all $i$: geometric mean

4.  $f(x)=1/x$ and $p_i=1/n$ for all $i$: harmonic mean

5.  $f(x)=x^2$ and $p_i=1/n$ for all $i$: root-mean-square

6.  $f(x)=x^d$ and $p_i=1/n$ for all $i$: power mean

7.  $f(x)=x^d$: weighted power mean

8.  $f(x)=2^{(1-\alpha)x}$, $\alpha\neq 1$, $x_i=-\log_2 p_i$: Rényi’s
    $\alpha$-entropy
